intro: Horkelia cuneata var. sericea, commonly known as silverleaf horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. Its silvery foliage gives it a distinctive appearance, making it a notable species in its native range.
